Chris can introduce you to 7 people at Facebook

Currently in use on highly demanding projects totaling more than $8 billion, Project Inertia brings together fragmented pieces of the construction process to create efficiencies, identifying and addressing constraints before they have a negative impact on budget or schedule.Wearing many hats every day, my primary task is to build systems, infrastructure, culture & processes that enable the company to scale and meet an explosively growing customer base.

Candi Controls builds embedded software & cloud-hosted infrastructure to enable bi-directional control of Internet of Things (IoT) & legacy devices in commercial and industrial buildings.  Wearing many hats, but mostly focused on:   - Guiding & growing the engineering team  - Thought leadership  - Improving processes & tools  - Large scale systems design  - Developing business models & roadmaps  - Enabling & managing partner relationships  - Translating complex technology to non-technical partners & investors

Co-founder, CTO & board member at Sherbit, a personal data analytics startup. Building internet scale big data analytics & aggregation backend with several frontends for mobile & web.  Gathered data from large numbers of IoT devices.- Integrating & normalizing data in real-time from thousands of data sources.   - Code-free provisioning & transformation of new data sources- Designed big-data analytics architecture that preserves data confidentiality while allowing population level metrics.- Built a scalable, on-demand, provider agnostic, cloud-deployed architecture.
San Francisco, CA & Los Angeles, CA

Based in San Francisco and Los Angeles, C32 is a software & electronics R&D and management consulting firm with clients from startups to F500s. We help companies understand how to use technology to maximize results by doing 'boundary layer' research and applying findings in culturally appropriate ways.   This is my own consulting firm that I use for side projects - a few other people are involved as well.Some of our recent projects➔ Built a big data analytics tools to discover vertical specific early stage companies with traction➔ Re-hosted major analytics platform, scaling from stand-alone to multi-tenant public cloud➔ Designed streaming digital music hardware retrofits for vintage stereos
Hacker League Qeo Connected Home Challenge - Judge Panel
Hacker League Qeo Connected Home Challenge - Judge Panel

Over the years, I have worked with over seventy venture backed startups.  These are some of the startups where I had a board position. I still hold board positions, but LinkedIn doesn't let you control order, so I am forcing it with an end date.Sherbit (2014 - present)https://www.sherbit.ioSherbit is a personal analytics platform.Arcimoto (2012 - 2014) http://www.arcimoto.comArcimoto is radically re-thinking transportation by building an affordable electric vehicle platform. New Earth (2010 – 2013) - http://www.earthster.orgNew Earth/Earthster has built one of the most widely used life cycle assessment platforms in the world. This platform allows organizations such as Walmart and the UN to assess environmental and other impacts of products, materials and processes. ChikPea Inc (2010 – 2011) http://www.chikpea.comChikPea's market leading cloud-based billing solutions enable metered, flat rate or other subscription-style billing to be varied over time, by market or by product combination. International Characters (2009 – Present)http://www.international-characters.comInternational Characters provides hardware based text-processing acceleration to a variety of industries. Colligent, Inc. (2006 - 2012)http://www.colligent.comColligent provides brand affinity analysis for social networks. GoldenEye (2008 – 2009)http://www.goldeneyedms.comGoldenEye built a cloud-based integrated ERP/CRM system for automotive dealerships.
VP Corporate Development & Engineering - Public Cloud & Big Data
San Francisco, Boston, Toronto, Germany & UK

Earthster is a cloud-based (SaaS) big-data startup which discovers & calculates sustainability metrics (LCA) across global supply chains.  Earthster raised a total $2.7m in funding from Walmart, Safeway, Georgia-Pacific & others.Built a core engineering team that re-factored a standalone big-data application for public cloud deployment as multi-tenant subscription service.  Delivered ISO-compliant lifecycle analysis (LCA) & visualizations through a platform agnostic HTML5 & Javascript browser interface designed to look & feel like a desktop application.Helped define long term product vision, including basic revenue model & product roadmap.  Managed North American and EU-based development teams.
Advised venture clients on potential partners, technology focus and ecosystem development.
Chief Strategy Officer & Co-Founder - Open Source Business + Technology Strategy

Olliance helped create an industry-wide paradigm shift, one company at a time, moving open source from the fringes to the mainstream.    Clients ranged from venture backed startups to national government and F100 companies.Helped Facebook, IBM, Accenture, eBay, Microsoft & others release large amounts of software under open source licenses and build future products around open source.  Worked with over 50 venture-backed startups on turn-arounds, revenue models & technology strategy with several successful exits.Olliance was sold to BlackDuck in December 2010.
Interim Chief Technology Officer (CTO) - Open Source Ecosystem
Free Standards Group (now the Linux Foundation)

The Linux Foundation is a non-profit consortium dedicated to fostering the growth of Linux. Created business & technical roadmap, responsible for re-vamping the Linux Standards Base (LSB) and evangelizing the new direction to the community.
Interim Chief Technology Officer (CTO) - Supply Chain Analytics

TRX provided supply chain insight to companies, with a specialization on tracking container shipments through customs clearance.  Built the front end, which provided information in real-time regarding current clearance status, down to the individual pallet, all through a SaaS-delivered service offering.  Clients included HP, GE Gas Turbines and other major companies.  Sold in 2002.

I had the privilege of working with Chris when I setup the Accenture Innovation Center for Open Source. Accenture asked Chris to assist us understanding the (commercial) open source market and identify key players, trends and technology directions relevant for large scale enterprises. We also leveraged Chris’ outstanding expertise to reflect and discuss our thoughts on shaping the Center strategically. Chris help was invaluable. His understanding of the open source market and communities in depth and breadth is very impressive. With his advice we were able to set strategic directions which - looking back - were absolutely spot on. Chris has this rare mix of very deep technology expertise and entrepreneurial leadership. I wouldn’t hesitate to hire him again and can warmly recommend Chris to any executive looking for advice in technology and business development.
